forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 48. West southwest wind around 6 mph.

forecast.name: Tuesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 60, with temperatures falling to around 57 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 3 to 17 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph.

weather_report:
As the cool evening settles over Downtown San Francisco, the air carries a mild whisper of clarity, with clear skies overhead and a serene low around 48 degrees. The gentle west-southwest wind, soft and unhurried, brushes past, adding a delicate chill to the vibrant nocturnal cityscape. The twinkling lights cast reflections on the still water, creating an inviting tableau that encourages a peaceful stroll along the Embarcadero or a quiet moment in one of the city’s cozy cafes.

For Tuesday, a sunny embrace awaits, promising an inviting high in the vicinity of 60 degrees. As the sun rises, the crispness will gradually give way to a warmth that will linger, although the afternoon’s decline to around 57 will remind us of that fleeting chill synonymous with coastal life. The winds will pick up in the afternoon, playful gusts nudging the various textures of the city, presenting an opportunity for invigorating, brisk walks or cycling adventures through Golden Gate Park, where the golden sun may peek through the canopies of trees, enhancing the day’s charm. Layers will be your allies; a light sweater paired with a comfortable shirt or a jacket will serve well as the temperatures fluctuate. In this delicate dance between warmth and cool, simple pleasures await, be it a good book at a sidewalk table or a spontaneous visit to an art gallery, savoring the beauty of the day in a city that never fails to inspire.
